title: Intel Wi-Fi Link Driver Netwtw04 Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Intel Wi-Fi Link Driver. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the processing of 802.11 frames. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.
addtionnal_details: Intel has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00338.html
timeline:
2019-11-27 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-04-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Haikuo Xie  and Ying Wang of Baidu Security Lab
